alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; South Aitkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 12 at 1:00PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and South Aitkin zones. .Warm temperatures will melt the snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Aitkin. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, The boat ramp at Aitkin city park floods. A few driveways become covered with water in the Cedarbrook area. Minor flooding of farmland occurs in the Cedarbrook community. At 15.0 feet, A few homes become surrounded by water in the Cedarbrook neighborhood near Eagle Rd. The Aitkin city park becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Friday morning. Additional rises to near 14.5 feet are possible by Monday. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Mississippi River Aitkin 13.0 10.9 Wed 11 am CD 12.3 13.1 13.7 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 700 PM CDT.
